p.s: The text Hope of escape lost in translation is written by Zia Haider Rahman and published by the weekly newspaper The Sunday Times on December 17th 2016.
The text begins with the surprising and shocking fact that translating British texts to languages of immigrants costs more then 100 million pounds.
But then, the main point of the text is stated: Translating the texts doesn't help the migrants to speak englishEnglish, and thus doesn't help integration.
The example of Brick Lane in London supports this, there are Bangladeshis at the bottom of education, durg abuse, and crimes.
The author himself sasy he didn't live there even as a migrant, because his parents and school helped him learn englishEnglish.
The next point of critique is the way diversity is handled, the celebration of multiculturalness, which doesn't help integration.
The author ends the text with the general statement that every problem need to be stand up against silence is acceptance.
